title: Beccles and Geldeston Circular Walk Route

images.title: Dr Neil Clifton / St. Michael's Church, Beccles, Suffolk: South and east faces of the tower
images.caption: St. Michael's Church, Beccles, Suffolk: South and east faces of the tower. Beccles church is in the centre of the town. It has its tower separated from the main building containing the nave. The tower is a prominent landmark from many miles around.

images.title: Barsham Hall from the south-west by Adrian S Pye, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Barsham Hall from the south-west

images.title: Barsham Marshes in February by Evelyn Simak, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Barsham Marshes in February

description: A pleasant circular walk using the Angles Way and other footpaths to explore the area around Beccles and Geldeston in Norfolk. The route includes a lovely long stretch along the River Waveney before passing Geldeston Dyke and heading through the countryside. On the way you can stop off at The Locks Inn in Geldeston for some refreshments. The riverside inn has a lovely large garden to relax in on warmer days.
